Example - subscribe to the "change" event during initialization

children.description: Fires when the current page has changed.

children.name: destroy
children.description: Unbinds all callbacks created within pager initialization. This method doesn't remove pager element from DOM.> This method does not remove the widget element from DOM.

children.name: refresh
children.description: Updates all values of pager elements so that these values fit the values of DataSource. This method is automatically called after DataSource change event is fired.

children.name: page
children.description: Gets or sets the current page.

children.name: pageSize
children.description: Returns the page size - maximum number of items allowed on one page.

children.description: Returns the number of pages.

Example - set the label before the pager input

children.name: messages
children.description: Defines texts shown within the pager. Use this option to customize or localize the pager messages.

children.name: refresh
children.description: Defines if a refresh button will be displayed. Click on that button will call DataSource read() method to get actual data.

children.name: previousNext
Example - hide the first, last, previous and next buttons

children.description: Defines if buttons for navigating to the first, last, previous and next pages will be shown.

children.name: pageSizes
Example - show the page size drop-down with custom values
Example - show the page size drop-down with default values

children.description: If set to `true` the pager will display a drop-down which allows the user to pick a page size.By default the page size drop-down is not displayed.Can be set to an array of predefined page sizes to override the default list.A special `all` value is supported. It sets the page size to the total number of records.If a `pageSize` setting is provided for the data source then this value will be selected initially.

children.name: numeric
Example - hides the numeric page links

children.description: Defines if numeric portion of the pager will be shown.

children.name: input
children.description: Defines if an input element which allows the user to navigate to given page will be displayed.

children.name: info
children.description: Defines if a label showing current paging information will be displayed.

children.name: linkTemplate
children.description: The template for page number links.

children.name: selectTemplate
Example - declare custom template for the selected page number

children.description: The template for selected page number link.

children.name: dataSource
children.description: Instance of kendo DataSource. See the [**kendo.data.DataSource**](/api/javascript/data/datasource).This option is mandatory because the Pager is tightly connected with DataSource. The pager is UI widget for managing paging over the DataSource. The Pager gets values like page size or total count of items from DataSource.

children.name: buttonCount
children.description: Defines the number of buttons displayed in the numeric pager.

children.name: autoBind
Example - disable reading the state of the DataSource instance during initialization

children.description: Indicates whether the pager refresh method will be called within its initialization.
